recipes.name: Chicken Spicy Rice
instructions: Boil chicken with pinch of salt and remove from bones.
In a non sticking pan take 2 tbsp of oil and fry cabbage and carrot until cooked. Don't overcook. Now put boiled peas and spring onion. Stir for few minutes and set aside.
Now heat 1/2 cup oil in (preferably) non sticking pan. Add 2 beaten eggs and mix vigorously.
Put chicken in it and stir for some time then put cooked vegetables.
Add green chillies and from salt to soya sauce. Mix well.
Now put boiled rice stir and shake well by covering and holding the pan from sides so that all things mix well.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Hyderabadi Khichdi
ingredients: A few sprigs of fresh green coriander, mint leaves chopped
instructions: Wash and soak lentils for 20 minutes.
Boil in just enough water with turmeric, till tender.
Wash and soak rice for 20 minutes. Bring water to boil.
Parboil rice with a little salt.
Drain the rice and set aside. Heat the oil.
Fry onions till golden brown.
Remove half and set aside. Add ginger and garlic paste and fry till golden.
Add turmeric and stir; add lentils and red chilli powder.
Cook for three minutes. Take a heavy-bottomed pan and brush a little oil in it. Spread half the parboiled rice; spread the lentils over the rice.
Sprinkle the ground spices.
Spread half of the coriander, mint and green chillies. Cover with remaining rice.
Sprinkle the fried onions, the rest of the coriander, mint leaves and green chillies and dot the rice with ghee.
Cook for about 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Nav Ratan Pulao
ingredients: 300 g basmati rice, washed and drained
instructions: Heat the oil in a heavy pan and add the cumin seeds.
When they start to pop, add the whole spices.
Stir a few times, then add the green chillies, all the vegetables, and the salt. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add the rice and fry until translucent.
Add 600 ml of hot water and bring to the boil, then lower heat, cover and cook until all the vegetables are soft but still crisp.
Serve hot, garnished with raisins.

recipes.name: Shahjahani Khichdi
instructions: Heat oil, add onion and fry till pink.
Add mince along with ginger garlic paste, salt, chilli powder, cumin crushed, garam masala powder and cardamom powder, fry well.
Now add yogurt fry well, cover and cook for 10 minutes till mince tender.
Add chopped mint leaves, coriander leaves and green chillies.
Heat oil in a pan.
Add brown onion, ginger garlic paste, soaked rice and lentils mixture, fry till light brown.
Now add turmeric, whole spices, salt and 2 cups of water, cover and cook till done.
To Serve: Spread cooked khichri over mince, add milk, fried onion on top.
Simmer for 15 minutes, before serving mix gently and remove from heat.

recipes.name: Landi Kotal Biryani
instructions: Heat oil fry sliced onion till golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste, crushed red chillies, salt, coriander seed and crushed cumin seed.
Put 1/2 cup water fry well add chicken fry more.
Add 1/2 cup more water and cover lid cook till chicken tender.
When chicken done add green coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chillies, spring onions and tomatoes remove from stove.
For Layer: In pan put half layer of boiled rice, and a layer of cooked chicken then layer of chick peas and rest of boiled rice.
Cover well and give steam for 15 minutes.
Serve hot with raita and salad.

recipes.name: Pulao Nawabi
instructions: Soak basmati rice for half an hour.
Heat ghee in a saucepan, and saute onion on medium heat till golden brown.
Drain and keep aside. In the same pan add cumin seeds.
When it begins to crackle, add cashew nuts and raisins and stir for half a minute.
Then add soaked rice and salt and enough water to cover the rice.
Bring it to a boil and reduce the heat to low.
Cover and let it cook on low heat till almost done.
Garnish with coriander and fried onion and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Coconut Shrimp Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat; add mustard seeds, and sauté until seeds begin to pop.
Add onion and next 4 ingredients, and sauté 3 minutes.
Add shrimp; sauté 2 to 3 minutes or just until they begin to turn pink.
Remove shrimp; cover and keep warm.
Add rice to the pan, and sauté 1 minute.
Stir in water and coconut milk; bring to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender.
Serve shrimp over rice.
Sprinkle with cilantro before serving.

recipes.name: Fragrant Red Lentils with Rice
instructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add diced onion, and sauté 6 minutes or until onion begins to brown. Add the ginger and next 5 ingredients (ginger though bay leaves), and sauté for 1 minute. Add 3 cups water, lentils, and salt, and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes or until lentils are tender. Discard bay leaves.
Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add green onions and jalapeño; sauté 5 minutes. Add to the lentil mixture; stir in juice, cilantro, and garam masala.
Place 1/2 cup rice into each of 5 shallow bowls; spoon 3/4 cup lentil mixture over rice. Top each serving with 1 tablespoon yogurt.
Note: Because jalapeño peppers can vary in heat intensity, you may wish to adjust the amount used based on your own preference for hot and spicy foods.

recipes.name: Burnt Chilli Rice
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic sliced round fried golden brown and drained on tissue paper
2 spring onions (just the leaves) finely chopped
1 tbsp finely chopped coriander to garnish
instructions: Heat oil in a pan add the chillies and fry for 1 minute or till they crackle then add the garlic and green onion.
Saute it for a minute and add the rice toss to mix well and heat the rice through.
Season with salt, pepper and soya sauce and paprika.
Now serve on a platter and garnish with fried garlic and coriander.
You can sprinkle some fish floss if you on top too before serving.

recipes.name: Spanish Rice
ingredients: 2 tbsp each tomato sauce and tomato puree
instructions: Boil the corn and keep aside.
Wash and soak the rice in water for 10-15 minutes.
Heat the oil in a saucepan, fry the onions till they turn light brown in colour and add the garlic. Fry briefly.
Add the vegetables and the boiled corn to the onion garlic mixture.
Add the tomato puree.
Cook till the puree dries, and add the tomato sauce.
Add the rice, and season well with the salt and pepper. Mix gently.
Add the vegetable stock.
Simmer over low heat.
When the rice is cooked, season it with the Worcestershire sauce.

recipes.name: Cholay Biryani
ingredients: 1 inch piece ginger (cut into thin strips)
instructions: Soak kabuli chana overnight in four cups of water.
Drain & pressure cook in 4 cups of water with salt & tea leaves tied in piece of muslin cloth, till tender.
Remove the muslin cloth bag and drain chickpeas.
Soak rice in three cups of water for about half an hour. Drain.
Boil four cups of water in a deep pan with salt & green cardamoms, bay leaves & cloves.
Add rice and cook till half done. Drain excess water.
Marinate boiled chickpeas in yogurt, ginger paste, ginger julienne, half of mint leaves, green chilli paste, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, garam masala & garlic paste.
Dissolve saffron in warm milk and mix in kewra water.
Place the marinated chickpeas in a deep non-stick pan.
Spread cooked rice over the chickpeas evenly.
Sprinkle dissolved saffron and half of the coriander leaves over rice.
Cover the pan tightly and put on low heat for fifteen minutes or till rice is cooked.
Serve hot garnished with remaining coriander leaves and mint leaves.

recipes.name: Afghani Chicken Biryani
instructions: Wash and soak rice for 20 minutes.
Parboil then in 10-12 cups of boiling water for 3-4 minutes and drain the water.
Clean and wash the chicken and make deep cuts.
In a wok or deep pot, heat cooking oil on medium heat for 4-5 minutes and golden fry the chicken on high heat.
Blend onions and tomatoes with 3 cups of water and pour it on the chicken.
Season with salt and black pepper, cover and cook on low heat until only half of the curry remains.
In a large pot, spread half of the boiled rice and place the whole chicken on them.
Cover the chicken with the remaining rice.
Pour the tomato gravy from the aside, cover and simmer on low heat for 20 minutes.
Remove the chicken and mix the rice well before dishing out.
Dish out the rice in a large round platter and place chicken in the middle. Garnish with pomegranate seeds on the side.

recipes.name: Seafood Fried Rice
ingredients: 5 gms salt and white pepper powder
instructions: Blanch all the vegetables and seafood. Keep aside.
Heat oil in wok and add egg yolk in a stream, stirring continuously.
When cooked, add all the vegetables and seafood.
Cook until the seafood is done.
Add rice, season with salt, pepper and soy sauce.
Toss well. Garnish with coriander and serve.

recipes.name: Coconut Curry Jasmine Rice
instructions: Melt butter in a medium saucepan. Add onion, and sauté until tender.
Add curry powder and rice; cook 2 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredients.
Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove bay leaf.
Note: Equal parts regular coconut milk and water may be substituted for light coconut milk.

recipes.name: Pulao in Hara Masala
ingredients: 1/2 blend in paste or crush well nutmeg
instructions: Heat the oil and add onions and the whole garam masala. Fry onions till the colour changes to light brown then add the hara masala and fry well till the colour and the aroma changes.
Now add the mutton pieces and cook well for 5 mins then add 1/2 cup water and cover.
When the water evaporates add the dry masalas with the salt and tomatoes and cook for another 5 mins.

Now add the water and the garam masala powder. When the water starts to boil then add the rice and cover the lid. When the half of the water is dried then leave the rice on very low flame for 10 mins.
Pulao is ready u can ser it with raita.
Note: Cooking mutton pulao then first make the mutton stock and use the stock instead of plain water and follow the same steps.

recipes.name: Kofta Pulao
instructions: To make the kofta:
In a grinder, dry grind roasted chana till it becomes fine powder.
To the raw keema add salt, a little chilli powder, shahzeera and roasted channa powder.
Grind this mixture into a fine paste and make lemon-sized balls and keep aside.
To make the curry:
In a vessel, take oil & add half garam masala, sliced onions and fry till golden brown.
Lower heat & add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, chilli powder, salt & ground paste.
Fry for 1 or 2 minutes while sprinkling some water.
Put curd and fry it for another 1 to 2 minutes.
Add 2 cups of water and when water boils put the kofta one by one.
Cook till the kofta are done and water dries up.
In another vessel, take enough water to boil & add remaining garam masala, & 2 tbsp salt.
Add rice. When the rice is three fourth cooked, drain out in a strainer.
In a thick bottom vessel spread half of ghee at bottom and pour half of the rice over it.
Spread out the kofta and the masala above it.
Sprinkle lime juice, coriander and mint leaves and green chillis.
Cover this again with a fresh layer of rice.
Put rest of the ghee on top with fried cashew nuts for garnishing.
Cover the vessel with a foil and a lid.
Put it on a medium flame for 12 to 15 minutes.
Mix slowly ensuring that the koftas do not break.
Serve hot with dahi ki chutney.

recipes.name: Cashew Nut Rice
instructions: Wash the rice 2 or 3 times with water and soak for 30 minutes.
In the meanwhile soak the cashew nuts in 1 cup water for just 15 minutes.
Bring water to a boil when boiling add the rice, turmeric powder and 1/4 tsp salt.
Rice should take about 11 minutes to cook.
Add a bit of oil leave for a minute and then throw the water and leave to dry.
Spread out on a tray and leave for 30 minutes.
In a wok heat oil dry the chili for one minute add the mustard seeds drained cashew nuts and curry leaves and fry for 30 seconds.
Add lemon juice and add the rice and mix it all together but carefully not to break the rice.
Sprinkle some freshly grated coconut if you like and serve.
Cashew nut rice is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Garlic Fried Rice
instructions: In a wok add the oil and garlic.
Now allow the oil to heat up on a moderate flame.
Once the garlic begins to sizzle add the onion a dash of salt and the rice.
Toss well to combine.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Garlic fried rice is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Minted Rice with Sprouted Beans
instructions: Heat the oil in a large, nonstick wok or frying pan.
When it is hot, add the spring onions and garlic and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add the cooked rice and continue to stir-fry over a high heat for 3-4 minutes.
Stir in the tomatoes and mixed sprouted beans and continue to cook over a high heat for 2-3 minutes or until warmed through.
Remove from heat, season and stir in the chopped mint leaves.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Mushroom Corn Rice
ingredients: 1/2 cup tinned or fresh mushrooms, chopped
instructions: Cook the rice in the water. Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a saucepan and fry the onions.
Then add the green chilli-garlic paste to it.
Add the mushrooms and sauté for a minute.
Add the corn, salt and pepper. Mix well and keep aside.
Melt the butter, add the flour and fry briefly.
Add the milk and stir so that no lumps are formed.
Continue cooking till a thick white sauce is formed.
Add the sauce to the mushrooms and mix well.
Arrange the rice on a serving plate.
Pour the mushroom sauce over it and top it with the almonds.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Rice Supreme
ingredients: 1/2 cup each boiled peas and corn
1/2 cup each chopped capsicum and carrot
1 cup each chopped sprouts and tomatoes
instructions: Heat the oil in a saucepan and fry the onions, garlic, capsicum and sprouts.
Add the carrots, peas and corn to the onion mixture. Sauté for 5 minutes.
Add the vegetable stock and seasoning cubes and mix well.
Then add the tomatoes. Wash the rice and add to the above mixture.
Add the parsley, salt and pepper. Mix well.
Simmer over medium heat till the rice is cooked.
Remove from the heat, add the Worcestershire sauce and mix lightly.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Gulabi Pulao
instructions: Cook rice. Boil beetroot till tender, then scrape.
Heat 1 tbsp ghee, fry mustard seeds, pepper, cumin seeds, gram dhal, urad dhal and chopped green chilies.
When these turns brown and finely chop onions, and add them with curry leaves.
Cook until soft. Now add boiled beetroot to these vegetables.
After a few minutes add salt, turmeric powder and grated coconut.
Fry for a few seconds. Mix this whole mixture well with the cooked rice.
Fry cashew nuts in remaining ghee and add, season with lemon juice.
Cover the pulao and keep on a low heat for a few minutes.
Serve hot, with plain yogurt.

recipes.name: Mango Rice
instructions: Clean the rice and put it in boiling water.
When it is about three quarters cooked, remove it from the heat.
Drain the excess water and allow the rice to cool.
Add the turmeric powder and half the quantity ghee. Mix well.
Cut the mangoes into tiny pieces or grate them.
Grind the cumin seeds, half the chilies, salt to taste and the coconut gratings.
Mix it with the mango pieces and add it to the cooked rice.
Fry the mustard seeds gram dhal, curry leaves and the remaining chilies in oil.
Add to the rice. Mix well.
Allow to cool and serve.

recipes.name: Fish Biryani
instructions: Cut and wash the fish and boil in a cup of water with salt.
Remove and bone it. Keep aside. Wash rice.
Peel tomatoes and squeeze out pulp and juice.
Hard boil eggs and shell. Boil potatoes, peep and cut into cubes.
Grind turmeric, cumin seed, chilies, and garlic and 1/2 onion to a paste.
Extract 3 cups of coconut milk.
Heat ghee in a saucepan, slice and fry remaining 1/2 onion, put in the rice and stir well.
When slightly brown, pour in the coconut milk.
Add water if necessary so that the liquid will be 2 fingers above rice level.
When the rice is almost cooked, add the ground paste, fish and salt.
Mix gently and reduce heat.
Cover saucepan and place live charcoal gently on the lid, or bake in a moderate oven, till the rice is sufficiently dry.
Serve garnished with slices of hard boiled eggs and potatoes.

recipes.name: Sultana Biryani
instructions: Heat oil, add chicken, ginger, garlic, fry well add whole garam masala, add curd, tomato, red chili, haldi, salt, jaipal jawatri, garam masala, cumin brown onion, almond paste.
Bhuno well, add stock and cook.
Now mix masala and boiled rice.
Spread green chili, coriander and keep on dam. Garnish with sultana and serve.

recipes.name: Paneer Kofta and Kebab Biryani
instructions: Portion the kheema 1/2 for kababs and 1/2 for kabab curry.
Boil kheema in ginger-garlic paste.
Add green chillies and salt to it. Cook until it gets dry.
Prepare balls and deep fry them.
For the Curry:
Take remaining kheema. Add green chillies paste, red chilli powder and keep it aside for 10-15 mins.
Prepare balls. In a pan, put little oil, add jeera. Then add onions and fry them until pink.
Then add tomatoes, red chilli powder and turmeric and cook until it leaves the edges of the pan.
Then add water and cook masala.
Then add prepared balls and cook until the gravy becomes thick.
Note: Drain water before preparing kababs. For Rice:
Grind onion, ginger and garlic to a paste. Heat ghee and add ground paste to it.
Fry until it turns light brown. Add the spices. Fry for a minute and then the rice water and salt.
Cover and cook till the rice is tender for the koftas. Roast gramflour to a golden brown.
Knead paneer, gramflour, ginger and green chillies to a smooth dough.
Make 20 equal sized koftas. Deep fry till light brown.
Final Stage:
Fluff the rice with a fork and remove whole spices.
Add koftas and toss gently.
Put gravy in the centre of the plate and garnish with koftas and fried kababs.

recipes.name: Junglee Pulao
ingredients: 1 tsp Red Chilli Powder (Pisi Lal Mirch) (or to taste)
A few strands of Fresh Coriander/Cilantro Leaves (Hara Dhania) (chopped)
4 tbsp Clarified Butter (Ghee) or Cooking Oil
instructions: Wash meat well. In a large pot, combine: meat, 4 cups water, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil and turn heat to medium and let meat cook covered until it is well done and water has completely dried. (If the meat has cooked but the water has not evaporated then turn heat to high and continue to fry meat until the water has completely dried.) Turn off heat and set aside.

Separately in a deep frying pan, heat a little clarified butter or cooking oil until well hot. Add all whole masalas and fry until they splutter. Add onions and fry until they turn brown. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, and tomatoes and mix. Add all of the rest powdered masala and fry masala well by adding a bit of water to avoid sticking/burning as needed.

Add cilantro/coriander leaves and continue to fry well until the clarified butter or oil starts to separate from the masala (a sign that the masala is well fried.) Add rice and fry for a minute or two or until the colour changes a bit. Add the cooked meat and 3 cups of water and mix. When water comes to a boil, lower heat and let rice simmer until they are well done and water has completely dried.

recipes.name: Kathal Jackfruit Rice Biryani
instructions: Soak the rice in 3 cups of water for half an hour. Drain.
Boil the rice in 6 cups of water, adding a little salt, 2 green cardamoms, 2 black cardamoms, the cloves and 1 stick of cinnamon, till half done.
Drain and refresh in cold water and drain again.
Grease a knife with oil & cut the jackfruit into slices.
Peel & cut into 1 and a half inch cubes.
Heat the oil in a kadai & deep fry the jackfruit cubes.
Drain & set aside.
In the same oil, deep fry half the onions till golden crisp. Drain.
In a separate pan, heat 3 tbsp of ghee.
Add the shahi jeera and remaining green cardamoms, black cardamom & crushed cinnaomon.
Add the remaining onions and saute for a few seconds.
Add the ginger paste and garlic paste and continue to saute.
Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander, chilli powder & continue to saute for 2 minutes.
Stir in the fried jackfruit cubes.
Add the yogurt, salt & coriander leaves.
Soak the saffron in lukewarm milk.
Preheat the oven to 200 degree C.
Arrange half the jackfruit mixture in a large oven proof dish.
Spread a layer of rice over the jackfruit.
Sprinkle saffron milk, garam masala powder, a few mint leaves & few drops of kewra over rice.
Layer the rest of jackfruit & rice.
Garnish with fried onions, a few mint laeaves and remaining kewra water.
Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil & cook in oven for 20-25 minutes.
Serve hot with raita.

recipes.name: Moti Kofta Rice Pulao
instructions: To make the koftas, add all the kofta ingredients (except egg) in minecemeat and grind twice on a sill or in food processor.
Add egg and mix well and refrigerate for 10-15 minutes.
Apply some Cooking Oil on hands and make small minecemeat balls.
Refrigerate for the koftas for 10-15 minutes.
To make the gravy, heat Dalda Cooking Oil in a pot on medium heat for 3-5 minutes and add whole garam masala.
When it pops, add onions and stir fry till golden.
Add all the gravy spices, yogurt and tomatoes and stir well until oil separates.
Add a cup of water and bring to a boil.
Add the koftas to the gravy and lightly shake the pot with potholders.
Cook until the water dries completely.
Sprinkle green chillies and fresh coriander and add 4-5 cups of water.
When it comes to a boil, add rice.
Cover and cook on medium heat till the water dries.
Simmer on low heat for 5-7 minutes.
Dish out care fully to prevent koftas from breaking.
Garnish with boiled eggs if you wish and serve hot.

recipes.name: Lamb Pulao
instructions: Heat 5 cups water.
Add the lamb, ginger powder, aniseed powder, asafoetida, and salt.
Cook covered on high heat until the lamb is almost done.
Separate the lamb from the stock. Put both aside.
Heat the ghee in a deep pot, add all the ingredients from cloves to almonds, and the lamb.
Saute for a minute, add rice and saute further for 1 minute.
Add 6 cups of stock (adding water if needed) and stir gently.
Mix saffron with a little hot water and grind.
Add to the pot, cook covered on high heat until the water is almost absorbed.
Place the pot on a griddle (tawa), cook covered on low heat, till the rice is done.
Sprinkle garam masala and serve.

recipes.name: Shahi Kabuli Pulao
instructions: Heat up oil in a pan and fry onions till golden brown.
Separate the fried onions and grind them.
Fry chicken pieces in the same oil till light golden and than add grinded onions.
Add 3 cups of water and cook for 10 minutes.
Add cloves, black cardamom, cinnamon sticks, green cardamom and white cumin seeds.
Cook till chicken tenders.
Separate chicken and add chicken stock cubes in the remaining mixture.
Add rice and mix well. Also place chicken pieces at the top.
Cover with lid and let the rice cook. Garnish with dried fruits when ready to serve.
For topping: Heat up 2 tbsp of oil in a pan and fry carrot, almond, pistachios, raisins, green cardamom powder and sugar. Cook for 5 minutes.
Sprinkle this mixture over rice and serve.

recipes.name: Kabab Biryani
instructions: For the kebab: Wash the minced beef and put in a strainer and gently press to squeeze out all the water.
Mix all the kebab ingredients to the minced and knead well, set aside for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan, divide minced mixture into lemon-sized balls, flatten with palm give shape like kebab and deep fry.
For the korma: Fry onions till golden brown.
Then make a paste of fried onion, yogurt and tomatoes.
Fry ginger, garlic then add the onion, yogurt, tomato paste in it.
Now add coriander powder, red chilli powder and salt; cook it for 2-3 minutes.
Then add green cardamom and plums, cook it till become korma.
For the rice: Bring to boil rice with white cumin, whole black peppercorn, cloves, large cardamoms, cinnamon stick and salt.
Then put in a strainer to squeeze out all the water.
To Assemble Biryani: Take medium size deep pot, put a layer of half rice at the bottom of the pot.
Now put a layer of korma then place half kebabs over it.
Put mint leaves, tomatoes, green chillies and ginger.
Then put a layer of remaining rice then put kebabs over it.
Add food colour and simmer for 10 minutes.
Delicious kebab biryani is ready.
Garnish with lemon slices, mint leaves and tomato; serve hot.

recipes.name: Kachay Gosht Ki Biryani
instructions: Rice preparation: Leave rice for half hour in water, then drain them.
Take water in a cooking pot.
Now add salt & black cumin in the above pot.
Also cardamom (bari ilaichi), green cardamom & black pepper.
Now add mint leaves a little bit, green chilies, clove & cinnamon.
Now add rice in the above pot, cover the lid.
Let it boil, see that you do not need to fully cook the rice at this point.
Take them off when they are half done.
Drain the rice.
Masala for gosht (Chicken): Take a bowl, add yogurt, almond powder, ginger-garlic paste & salt.
Also add garam masala & kachri powder.
Mix them well & mix the chicken in it too.
Leave it for 1-2 hour.
Fry the onions (slice cut) & keep them for later use.
To Assemble Biryani: Take a cooking pot, add meat & yogurt in it.
Add fried onions with some oil (add half of the fried onions).
Add lemon juice.
Then add the rice on top of meat.
Now add the remaining fried onions with some oil.
Add saffron (zafraan) mixed milk & khoya.
Cover the lid & leave for 25 min to cook on slow heat.
After that the dish is ready.
Serve this biryani with raita.

recipes.name: Lasani Biryani
instructions: Boil meat in water.
Coarsely grind star aniseeds and green and black cardamoms in a blender.
Heat a little oil in a pot and fry onions till they turn golden.
Separate some of the onions and keep them aside.
Add meat, dried plums, ginger/garlic, red chillies, salt, turmeric powder, ground masalas, bay leaves, caraway seeds, black pepper and yogurt to the pot. Cook on high flame.
Add tomatoes, half of coriander and mint leaves and 6 green chillies. Cook till water almost dries.
Add cream after a few minutes and cook till dry, place a layer of rice over the masala.
Put the remaining green chillies and mint and coriander leaves, hot spices powder, food colouring and screw pine over rice.
Cover with a lid and keep on dum for 10 minute.
Delicious Lasani Biryani is ready, take it out in a serving dish garnish with remaining fried onions and serve.

recipes.name: Arabian Rice
instructions: In a pan add oil and chopped onion then saute it.
Add tomato, garlic and all ingredients cook for 5 minutes.
Put 2 cup of water add add chicken in it cook until half done.
Take out chicken from pan and bake at 180C for 20 minutes.
In masala add rice and let it steam.
Dish out rice and put baked chicken on rice.
Ready to serve.

recipes.name: Saloni Biryani
instructions: Soak rice for 20 to 30 minutes.
Wash and boil beef put aside.
Heat oil fry onion till golden brown.
Put cassia, all whole spices, ginger garlic paste and fry well.
Add tomatoes, red chilli powder, garam masala powder, turmeric, coriander powder and dried plums, let it cook till tomatoes soften.
Put beef and let it cook for a while.
Now add 2 green chillies, remove from stove.
For Layering: In a pan heat 2-3 tbsp oil put cummin seed.
Boil rice and strain water.
Now in boiled rice pour prepared gravy, coriander leaves and green chillies
Sprinkle yellow colour and kewra.
Cover lid and steam for 8-10 minutes.
Serve with salad or raita.

recipes.name: Meat Dry Fruit Pulao
ingredients: Rice, boiled with cloves and bay leaves 2 kg
Nuts thinly cut and grounded 2 tsp
instructions: Cut the mutton into small pieces and marinate with salt, ginger, pepper, vinegar, sugar, soya sauce and lemon.
Make cuts on mutton pieces with a fork so that spices penetrate them.
Marinate for 3-4 hours.
Place these mutton pieces in a pot, add enough water to make mutton tender.
Cook on medium heat until water has dried.
Now add oil in this pot, along with corn flour solution dissolved in water to thicken the gravy.
Fry the meat for a while.
In an other pan, add marinate, corn dry fruits and fry them.
Add the mixture in the mutton pot.
Keep some of the dry fruits for garnishing.
In the boiled rice, add food color and simmer for a few minutes on low heat.
Take out rice in the serving plate and mix them with mutton.
Garnish with dry fruits and salad.

recipes.name: Mint and Yogurt Biryani
ingredients: Chicken 1 kilo or whole chicken cut in small pieces
Black or White Zeera which ever available 2tsp
instructions: Soak rice in water.
Boil the rice in water with 3tsp of salt.
In frying pan fry onion till brown.
In bowl add yougart, salt, black pepper, lemon, green chilies grounded, mint half a bunch.
Now add chicken in it and mix well.
In pot now put marinated chicken pieces without sause and cook chicken on medium flame till its cooked.
In big pot add cooked chiken and sause cook on high flame till sause mix up with chicken.
Now layer up rice on chiken, then fried onion with oil, zeera, food colour and mint.
Keep it on low flame with lid on pot for 5min.
After 10min mix it well.
Biryani is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Irani Biryani
instructions: Put some oil and chopped onions in a sauce pan and fry the onion till they change their colour to a light brown colour.
Take fried onions out on to a tissue pepper to let excess oil out and grind half of the brown onions.
Now fry some cashews and almonds in the same pan, a little then.
Take the nuts out after a couple of minutes and grind them in blender.
Fry the potatoes in the same pan as well until they are cooked.
Put the meat into the same saucepan and fry the meat.
Add fried onions, cumin(jeera)powder, black pepper, saffron (1tsp), red chilli powder, green cardamom(illaiche) powder, green chilli, salt and cook the ingredients.
Now add ginger garlic paste and lemon juice and cook all the ingredients well
Add water and fried onions in to the meat, cover it for 15 mins to let it cook well.
In another pan boil the rice (do not boil the rice fully).
Take another pan and add a layer of rice in the pan.
Cover the rice with the meat.
Add another layer of rice covering the meat.
Sprinkle ground cashew's and almonds, kewra, pinch of saffron(not necessary), and brown grinded onions.
Cover the biryani with a tight lid and let the rice fully cook.
Dish out in a platter and serve it with raita and salad of your choice.

recipes.name: Chicken Drumstick Biryani
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and fry onion golden brown, take out little brown onion and keep aside.
Then add ginger garlic paste and whole all spices in same pan with remaining onion and fry for 1-2 minutes.
Now add chicken drumsticks, salt, coriander powder, chili flakes, cumin, green coriander leaves, green chilies, tomatoes and yogurt fry for a while and cook covered.
In a large vessel boil rice with salt till half done.
Now take out little rice and spread on drumsticks and let the remaining rice boil till done.
Now strain rice in colander and spread on drumsticks.
In the last step spread fried onion and sprinkle dissolved yellow food color and saffron on rice and put on simmer for about 10-12 minutes.
Delicious drumsticks biryani is ready!

recipes.name: Yakhni Pulao
instructions: In a large skillet add mutton, 7 glasses water, salt, whole onions, garlic and ginger.
Take a muslin cloth, put fennel seeds, whole coriander seeds, black cardamom and white cumin.
Tie a tight knot and place into the skillet.
Now cook this stock for approx forty five minutes, till meat tenders, separate meat from stock.
Heat oil in another skillet.
Add sliced onions and fry till they turn golden brown.
Now add whipped yogurt to the onions in the skillet along with ginger garlic paste, green cardamoms, black cumin, pepper corn, cloves and green chilies.
Stir fry the gravy for few minutes, then add mutton and cook till oil forms a layer over the gravy.
Add the stock and heat until the mixture starts to boil.
Drain the water from the soaked rice and add the rice to the skillet.
Add salt and cook on a medium heat, till water dries.
Cover and steam for 10 minutes.
Serve in a dish with mint raita.

recipes.name: Beef with Fried Rice
instructions: Apply salt and ½ tsp black pepper powder on beef and leave for 15 minutes.
Heat ¼ cup oil in pan and stir fry beef strips until done.
Heat remaining oil and add egg, spring onion, capsicum, carrot and sauté for 2 minutes or eggs cooked.
Now add fried beef, boiled rice, soya sauce, and remaining black pepper powder (adjust salt). Toss gently.
Serve with some gravy.

recipes.name: White Masala Biryani
ingredients: For Mutton: Green chillies ground 2 tsp
For Mutton: Brown onion ½ cup
instructions: In a pan put all together water, garlic, bay leaf, fennel seeds, cinnamon, black cardamom, and coriander and cook for 20 minutes.
Strain the stock and keep aside.
Add this stock to the pan add in mutton with sliced onion, salt, cloves, black cardamom, green cardamom, green chilies and cook till mutton half done.
Now add potatoes, yogurt, tomatoes slice and brown onion and cook until water dries and mutton fully cooked.
Boil rice with salt till half done. Drain rice.
In a pan spread mutton mixture cover with boil rice.
Heat oil and pour on top of rice.
Simmer for 15 minutes on low flame, delicious white masala biryani is ready to be served.

recipes.name: Fish Biryani
instructions: Heat oil add whole spices, fenugreek and tomatoes.
Add brown onion with ginger garlic paste, all the dry seasonings, fry well.
Add whipped yogurt with potatoes and 1 cup water, cover and cook till potatoes tender.
Add fish, cover and cook for 10 minutes, remove fish.
Add chopped coriander and green chilies.
In a pan arrange a layer of ½ boiled rice with fish masala and potato mixture top with remaining rice.
Top with Kewra and yellow color.
Put fish pieces on top, leave it on steam for 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Nawabi Andy ki Biryani
ingredients: Rice ½ kg (boiled with 2 tbsp salt)
Saffron ¼ tsp (dissolved in ¼ cup milk)
instructions: Heat oil add whole spices add brown onion, ginger garlic paste, turmeric and chili powder, fry well.
Add potatoes, peas and ½ cup water.
Cover and cook till potatoes tender.
Add yogurt, boiled eggs, in a pan spread ½ boiled rice, cooked egg mixture, topped with green chili, coriander, mint remaining rice, sprinkle Kewra and saffron mixture.
Leave it on simmer for 15 minutes.
Nawabi Andy ki Biyrani is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Masala Prawn Rice
instructions: Heat oil add onions and fry for 2 minutes.
Add ginger garlic paste and seekh kakab masala.
Add tomatoes and let masala cook until water is dry.
Add enough water to cook rice let it come to a boil.
Add rice and salt.
Then add green chili, peas and mushrooms.
Cook until all water is absorbed and rice is cooked.
Fry prawns separately and mix with rice.
Garnish and serve.

recipes.name: Egg Fried Rice
ingredients: Black pepper and salt to taste
instructions: Add water in a pot and some salt when water starts boiling add rice. Cook until they get boil.
Add oil in a frying pan and put onion in it adds garlic paste, black pepper and salt. Then add beaten eggs in it and finally add boiled rice. Toss gently.
Serve in a plate and garnish with parsley leaves.
Note: If you want then you can add more vegetables after frying them.

recipes.name: Mexican Chicken With Fried Rice
ingredients: For White Sauce: Salt ½ tsp
For White Sauce: Pepper ½ tsp
For White Sauce: Mustard ½ tsp
For White Sauce: Water as required
For Fried Rice: Oil ¼ cup
For Fried Rice: White pepper ½ tsp
For Fried Rice: Soya sauce 1 tbsp
For Fried Rice: Carrot ½ cup (finely chopped)
For Fried Rice: Spring onion 1 cup (chopped)
instructions: For White Sauce: Put altogether in a pan and cook till thick.
For Chicken: Heat oil add ginger garlic paste with chicken and fry for 10 minutes.
Then add salt, paprika, orange color, black pepper and water, cover and cook for 15 minutes.
Then add ketchup, oregano, white sauce, capsicum and onion sliced.
Cook for another 10 minutes till chicken done and thick gravy remains.
Serve with fried rice.
For Rice: Heat oil add crushed garlic fry till light golden.
Add rice with salt, white pepper, soya sauce, chopped carrots and spring onions, toss well.
Serve with Mexican chicken.

recipes.name: Memoni Akni
instructions: Soak rice in water for 20 minutes.
Heat half cup oil in a pan.
Add sliced onion and fry until light brown.
Then add garam masala powder, meat, ginger garlic paste and roast well.
Now add tomatoes, 1 ½ tsp salt, turmeric and red chili powder. Roast again.
Then add 1 cup water, cover and cook until mutton become half tender.
Then add potatoes and 1 cup water.
Now cook potatoes and mutton till complete tender.
Add soaked rice, remaining ½ tsp salt and 1 ½ cup water, cover and cook rice until cooked.
Simmer on low heat for 15 minutes.
Finally sprinkle whole green chili and chopped coriander leaves.
Delicious Memoni Akni is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Rice Macaroni Biryani
instructions: Boil Macaroni in boiling salted water for 5 to 6 minutes.
Drain and rinse under cold running water.
Mix 1 tbsp of oil in Macaroni and set aside.
Fry the chopped onions and tomatoes for 2 minutes on high flame.
Add chicken and Spice mix and fry for a minute.
Add in water and bring it to boil.
Cover the lid and cook on slow heat for 20 minutes.
Remove the lid to minimize the gravy.
Add green chilies, mint leaves and Macaroni and toss all ingredients.
Serve while hot.

recipes.name: Burnt Chilli Rice
ingredients: Garlic 2 cloves sliced round fried golden brown and drained on tissue paper
Spring onions 2 (just the leaves) finely chopped
Corriander to garnish 1 tbsp finely chopped
instructions: Heat oil in a pan add the chillies and fry for 1 minute or till they crackle then add the garlic and green onion
Saute it for a minute and add the rice toss to mix well and heat the rice through.
Season with salt, pepper and soya sauce and paprika.
Now serve on a platter and garnish with fried garlic and corriander.
You can sprinkle some fish floss if you on top too before serving.
